snippet: Senator Charles Schumer said Monday that Apple and Google planned to meet with him to discuss a privacy loophole on smartphones that give apps unfettered access to people's personal photos. On Sunday, Mr. Schumer said that he planned to ask the Fe...
abstract: Senator Charles Schumer said Monday that Apple and Google planned to meet with him to discuss a privacy loophole on smartphones that give apps unfettered access to people's personal photos. On Sunday, Mr. Schumer said that he planned to ask the Federal Trade Commission to investigate Apple and Google after the photo privacy situation came to light.

headline.main: Apple and Google to Meet With Senator Over Privacy

snippet: The iPad, considered a side business for Apple when it was introduced in 2010, accounted for $9.15 billion in revenue in the holiday quarter, about 20 percent of Apple’s total revenue.

headline.main: As New iPad Debut Nears, Some See Decline of PCs
headline.print_headline: In Flood of New Tablet Devices, Some See Decline of the Desktop Machine

snippet: American companies supplying materials to China led the decline despite a unexpectedly positive federal report on service sector growth.
abstract: Stocks decline, led by American companies supplying materials to China, after country trims its 2012 forecast for economic growth.

headline.main: Share Prices Dip Again as China Cuts Its Forecast
headline.print_headline: Share Prices Dip Again As China Cuts Its Forecast

snippet: The iPad, considered a side business for Apple when it was introduced in 2010, created an entire new category of consumer electronics. Soon tablets will be more popular that PCs, some analysts say.
abstract: The iPad, considered a side business for Apple when it was introduced in 2010, created an entire new category of consumer electronics. Soon tablets will be more popular that PCs, some analysts say.

headline.main: As New iPad Debut Nears, Some See Decline of PCs

snippet: Apple has made its first attempt to quantify how many American jobs can be credited to the sale of its products, Nick Wingfield reports in Monday's Times. The total includes the Apple engineers who design the devices and the drivers who deliver th...
abstract: Apple has made its first attempt to quantify how many American jobs can be credited to the sale of its products, Nick Wingfield reports in Monday's Times. The total includes the Apple engineers who design the devices and the drivers who deliver them - even the people who build the trucks that get them there.

headline.main: Daily Report: How Many Jobs Has Apple Created?

snippet: Dragon Go is a voice-control app that can do things Siri can't, such as book a flight, make dinner reservations and find music on streaming services.
abstract: Dragon Go is a voice-control app that can do things Siri can't, such as book a flight, make dinner reservations and find music on streaming services.

headline.main: A Voice App Unapologetically Unlike Siri
headline.print_headline: For Siri, Competition That Doesn’t Talk Back

snippet: In an effort to show its benefit to the American job market, Apple on Friday published the results of a study it commissioned saying that it had “created or supported” 514,000 American jobs.

headline.main: Apple’s Job Creation Data Spurs an Economic Debate
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Job Creation Data Spurs an Economic Debate

snippet: With diversions like e-mail, Twitter, YouTube and games a few taps away, the book-reading experience on a tablet is more like a 21st-century cacophony than a traditional solitary activity.

headline.main: Finding Your Book Interrupted ... By the Tablet You Read It On
headline.print_headline: Finding Your Book Interrupted ... By the Tablet You Read It On

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MATT RICHTEL

snippet: Readers react to a Sunday Review essay about innovation by Bell Labs.
abstract: Letter from Bell Labs president Jeong Kim comments on the February 26 Jon Gertner Op-Ed article on the success of Bell Labs in bringing about innovations and technology, which has had a lasting impact on society.
